content_standards.overview: Formatting, content standards, and PR analysis patterns for release notes. Ensures consistent, user-focused documentation in docs/update-notes.

element.name: frontmatter
element.format: --- description: A concise summary of the release. keywords: - roo code x.y.z - new features - bug fixes image: /img/social-share.jpg ---

element.name: title
element.requirements: - Include version number - Include release date in ISO 8601 format - Date from GitHub tag OR current date if PR list provided

element.name: summary_sentence
element.example: This release adds context condensing, improves performance, and fixes UI bugs.

element.name: inline_hero_image
element.location: Immediately after the intro summary sentence
element.rules: - Insert only if frontmatter image path resolves to "/img/..." and is not "/img/social-share.jpg" - Use an HTML image tag per site rules with width="600" - Set src from .roo/tmp/release-notes/frontmatter_image_v[version].txt and alt to "Roo Code v[VERSION] Release"

framework.step: How does this impact users? (Concrete benefits)

category.name: major_features
category.template:
## [Feature Name]
We've [improvement description] (thanks [contributors]!) ([#PR](link)):
- **[Benefit 1]**: [How this helps users] - **[Benefit 2]**: [Another benefit]
[Concluding sentence about impact]
> **ðŸ“š Documentation**: See [Feature Guide](/path/to/feature) for detailed usage instructions.

category.name: qol_improvements
category.critical: MUST come before Bug Fixes section

category.name: bug_fixes
category.format: Under ## Bug Fixes as bullet points
category.critical: MUST come after QOL Improvements section

documentation_flags.flag: Completely new feature requiring new page
New examples or use cases to add
Migration guide needed for breaking changes

expanded_sections.format:
## Feature Name
Description of what the feature does (thanks contributor!) ([#PR](link)):
- **Key Point 1**: Explanation of this aspect. - **Key Point 2**: Another explanation.
Concluding sentence about the benefit.
> **ðŸ“š Documentation**: See [Feature Guide](/path/to/feature) for detailed usage.

grouped_sections.format:
## Section Name
* **Item Name**: Single-line description (thanks contributor!) ([#PR](link)) * **Another Item**: Another description ([#PR](link))

contributor_acknowledgments.rules: - Omit @ from GitHub usernames - Place inside parentheses before PR link - Include both PR author and issue reporter - List PR author first - If PR author equals issue reporter, use a single username once - Do not thank these names: outlined in the special instructions section `Release Notes "thank you" exclusions`

placement.expanded: In intro paragraph or bullet points
placement.grouped: At end of each bullet point

section_ordering.order: 1. Major feature sections (each with own heading) 2. ## QOL Improvements 3. ## Bug Fixes 4. ## Misc Improvements 5. ## Provider Updates 6. ## Documentation Updates
section_ordering.critical: QOL Improvements MUST always come before Bug Fixes

index_updates.rules: - List chronologically, newest first - Use absolute paths from site root (no /docs prefix) - Omit .md extension - Include release date in ISO 8601 format

sidebar_updates.rules: - Add to "Update Notes" category - Use Docusaurus ID format - Maintain chronological order

combined_notes_updates.description: Integrate patch releases into parent minor/major file
combined_notes_updates.rules: - Add changes to corresponding existing sections - Maintain consistent formatting and section order - Append new items to end of respective sections - Consolidate duplicate fixes across patches - Update summary sentence if significant features added

patterns.see_also: > **ðŸ“š Documentation**: See [Feature Guide](/path) for detailed usage instructions.
patterns.migration: > **ðŸ”„ Migration Guide**: If upgrading from v[OLD], see our [migration guide](/migration/vX-to-vY).

documentation_links.rules: - Use absolute paths starting from root (without /docs prefix) - No .md extensions in links - All major features must have documentation links

content_standards.forbidden_elements: - "Summary" or "Highlights" sections in docs/update-notes (Discord announcements may use "Feature Highlights") - Version numbers in docs outside update-notes - Temporal references like "as of version X.Y.Z" - Marketing language or buzzwords - Generic headings like "## Changes" or "## Updates"

discord_formatting.overview: Discord announcements preserve the original structure and headings from source release notes. Only minimal transformations are applied for platform compatibility.
discord_formatting.core_principle: Preserve original headings and section structure from the source release notes files exactly. Do NOT rename, merge, or reorganize sections. The Discord version should mirror the docs version.

element.name: wrapper
element.description: Wrap the entire announcement in a markdown code block

element.name: title
element.rules: - No emoji in title - Use "Release Updates" for both single and combined versions - For combined announcements, use "X.Y.Z-X.Y.Z" range formatting

element.name: tagline
element.format: @everyone [short hero summary derived from source intro sentence]
element.rules: - Discord only (omit from Reddit) - Derive from the source file's intro/summary sentence

element.name: sections
element.rules: - Copy all section headings EXACTLY as they appear in source docs - Preserve the original section order from source docs - Copy all bullet points and sub-bullets exactly as they appear - No emojis in section headers - Use hyphen bullets ("- ") instead of asterisk bullets ("* ")

element.name: footer_blurb
element.rules: - Use markdown inline links with the version as the anchor text - For multiple versions, join links with " | "

content_rules.rule: Preserve original section headings exactly as in source docs
Preserve original bullet points and structure exactly
No version numbers in body text (only header/footer)
Remove PR links/numbers from all content
Convert any relative docs links to absolute https://docs.roocode.com paths
Remove inline hero images from output

compression_only_on_request.trigger: User explicitly requests "compress", "condense", or content exceeds 2000 chars
compression_only_on_request.behavior: Only when triggered, summarize smaller sections into a "More Changes" paragraph. Still preserve major feature section headings even when compressing.

reddit_formatting.overview: Reddit announcements preserve the original structure and headings from source release notes. Only minimal transformations are applied for platform compatibility.
reddit_formatting.core_principle: Preserve original headings and section structure from the source release notes files exactly. Do NOT rename, merge, or reorganize sections. The Reddit version should mirror the docs version.
